name: lib/attributes/attribute-boolean.js
AttributeBoolean
description:
The value of this attribute is always a boolean. Null values are coerced to false.

String attributes can be queries using `equal` and `not`. Matching on
`greaterThan` and `lessThan` is not supported.

name: lib/attributes/attribute-collection.js
AttributeCollection
description:
Collection attributes provide basic support for one-to-many relationships.
For example, Threads in N1 have a collection of Labels or Folders.

When Collection attributes are marked as `queryable`, the RxDatabase
automatically creates a join table and maintains it as you create, save,
and delete models. When you call `persistModel`, entries are added to the
join table associating the ID of the model with the IDs of models in the collection.

Collection attributes have an additional clause builder, `contains`:

```coffee
db.findAll(Thread).where([Thread.attributes.categories.contains('inbox')])
```

This is equivalent to writing the following SQL:

```sql
SELECT `Thread`.`data` FROM `Thread`
INNER JOIN `ThreadLabel` AS `M1` ON `M1`.`id` = `Thread`.`id`
WHERE `M1`.`value` = 'inbox'
ORDER BY `Thread`.`last_message_received_timestamp` DESC
```

The value of this attribute is always an array of other model objects.

Section: Database

unknown.tagValue: {Matcher} - Matcher for objects containing the provided value.

return.description: Matcher for objects containing the provided value.

name: lib/attributes/attribute-datetime.js
AttributeDateTime
description: The value of this attribute is always a Javascript `Date`, or `null`.

unknown.tagValue: {Matcher} - Matcher for objects greater than the provided value.

return.description: Matcher for objects greater than the provided value.

unknown.tagValue: {Matcher} - Matcher for objects less than the provided value.

return.description: Matcher for objects less than the provided value.

unknown.tagValue: {Matcher} - Matcher for objects greater than or equal to the provided value.

return.description: Matcher for objects greater than or equal to the provided value.

unknown.tagValue: {Matcher} - Matcher for objects less than or equal to the provided value.

return.description: Matcher for objects less than or equal to the provided value.

name: lib/attributes/attribute-joined-data.js
AttributeJoinedData
description:
Joined Data attributes allow you to store certain attributes of an
object in a separate table in the database. We use this attribute
type for Message bodies. Storing message bodies, which can be very
large, in a separate table allows us to make queries on message
metadata extremely fast, and inflate Message objects without their
bodies to build the thread list.

When building a query on a model with a JoinedData attribute, you need
to call `include` to explicitly load the joined data attribute.
The query builder will automatically perform a `LEFT OUTER JOIN` with
the secondary table to retrieve the attribute:

```coffee
db.find(Message, '123').then (message) ->
// message.body is undefined

db.find(Message, '123').include(Message.attributes.body).then (message) ->
// message.body is defined
```

When you call `persistModel`, JoinedData attributes are automatically
written to the secondary table.

JoinedData attributes cannot be `queryable`.

Section: Database

name: lib/attributes/attribute-number.js
AttributeNumber
description: The value of this attribute is always a number, or null.

name: lib/attributes/attribute-object.js
AttributeObject
description: The value of this attribute is always an object that can be cast to `itemClass`

name: lib/attributes/attribute-string.js
AttributeString
description:
The value of this attribute is always a string or `null`.

String attributes can be queries using `equal`, `not`, and `startsWith`.
Matching on `greaterThan` and `lessThan` is not supported.

name: lib/attributes/attribute.js
Attribute
description:
The Attribute class represents a single model attribute, like 'account_id'.
Subclasses of {Attribute} like {AttributeDateTime} know how to covert between
the JSON representation of that type and the javascript representation.
The Attribute class also exposes convenience methods for generating {Matcher} objects.

unknown.tagValue: {Matcher} - Matcher for objects `=` to the provided value.

params.name: val
params.description: The attribute value

return.description: Matcher for objects `=` to the provided value.

unknown.tagValue: {Matcher} - Matcher for objects in the provided array.

params.name: val
params.description: An array of values

return.description: Matcher for objects in the provided array.

unknown.tagValue: {Matcher} - A matcher for objects `!=` to the provided value.

params.name: val
params.description: The attribute value

return.description: A matcher for objects `!=` to the provided value.

unknown.tagValue: {SortOrder} - Returns a descending sort order for this attribute

return.description: Returns a descending sort order for this attribute

unknown.tagValue: {SortOrder} - Returns an ascending sort order for this attribute

return.description: Returns an ascending sort order for this attribute

name: lib/attributes/matcher.js
OrCompositeMatcher
description: This subclass is publicly exposed as Matcher.Or.

name: AndCompositeMatcher
description: This subclass is publicly exposed as Matcher.And.

name: NotCompositeMatcher
description: This subclass is publicly exposed as Matcher.Not.

name: Matcher
lib/attributes/sort-order.js
SortOrder
lib/attributes.js
content:
import Matcher from './attributes/matcher'
import SortOrder from './attributes/sort-order'
import AttributeNumber from './attributes/attribute-number'
import AttributeString from './attributes/attribute-string'
import AttributeObject from './attributes/attribute-object'
import AttributeBoolean from './attributes/attribute-boolean'
import AttributeDateTime from './attributes/attribute-datetime'
import AttributeCollection from './attributes/attribute-collection'
import AttributeJoinedData from './attributes/attribute-joined-data'

module.exports = {
  Matcher: Matcher,
  SortOrder: SortOrder,

  Number: (...args) => new AttributeNumber(...args),
  String: (...args) => new AttributeString(...args),
  Object: (...args) => new AttributeObject(...args),
  Boolean: (...args) => new AttributeBoolean(...args),
  DateTime: (...args) => new AttributeDateTime(...args),
  Collection: (...args) => new AttributeCollection(...args),
  JoinedData: (...args) => new AttributeJoinedData(...args),

  AttributeNumber: AttributeNumber,
  AttributeString: AttributeString,
  AttributeObject: AttributeObject,
  AttributeBoolean: AttributeBoolean,
  AttributeDateTime: AttributeDateTime,
  AttributeCollection: AttributeCollection,
  AttributeJoinedData: AttributeJoinedData,
};

name: lib/browser/coordinator.js
Coordinator
description:
To use RxDB, you need to attach the coordinator in your Electron browser process.
It handles message dispatch across windows and manages the state of database
files when they need to be created before use. Just import it and instantiate one:

```js
import {Coordinator} from 'electron-rxdb';
global._coordinator = new Coordinator();
```

name: lib/console-utils.js
lib/database-change-record-debouncer.js
DatabaseChangeRecordDebouncer
description:
DatabaseChangeRecordDebouncer.accumulate is a guarded version of trigger that can accumulate changes.
This means that even if you're a bad person and call `persistModel` 100 times
from 100 task objects queued at the same time, it will only create one
`trigger` event. This is important since the database triggering impacts
the entire application.

name: lib/database-change-record.js
DatabaseChangeRecord
description:
An RxDB database emits DatabaseChangeRecord objects once a transaction has completed.
The change record contains a copy of the model(s) that were modified, the type of
modification (persist / destroy) and the model class.

DatabaseChangeRecords can be serialized to JSON and RxDB transparently bridges
them between windows of Electron applications. Change records of the same type
and model class can also be merged.

name: lib/database-object-registry.js
DatabaseObjectRegistry
description:
This keeps track of constructors so we know how to inflate
serialized objects.

We map constructor string names with factory functions that will return
the actual constructor itself.

The reason we have an extra function call to return a constructor is so
we don't need to `require` all constructors at once on load. We are
wasting a very large amount of time on bootup requiring files that may
never be used or only used way down the line.

If 3rd party packages want to register new inflatable models, they can
use `register` and pass the constructor generator along with the name.

Note that there is one registry per window.

name: lib/database-setup-query-builder.js
DatabaseSetupQueryBuilder
description:
The factory methods in this class assemble SQL queries that build Model
tables based on their attribute schema.

name: lib/rx-database.js
RxDatabase
description:
The RxDatabase is the central database object of RxDB. You can instantiate
as many databases as you'd like at the same time, and opening the same
database path in multiple windows is fine - RxDB uses SQLite transactions and
dispatches change events across windows via the Electron IPC module.

This class extends EventEmitter, and you can subscribe to all changes to the
database by subscribing to the `trigger` event.

For more information about getting started with RxDB, see the Getting Started
guide.

name: disconnect
description:
Typically, instances of RxDatabase are long-lasting and are created in
renderer processes when they load. If you need to manually tear down an instance
of RxDatabase, call `disconnect`.

name: _query
description:
Executes a SQL string on the database. If a query is made before the database
has been opened, the query will be held in a queue and run / resolved when
the database is ready.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} - Resolves when the query has been completed and rejects when
the query has failed.

params.name: query
params.description: A SQLite SQL string

params.name: values
params.description: An array of values, corresponding to `?` in the SQL string.

return.description:
Resolves when the query has been completed and rejects when
the query has failed.

name: find
description:
Creates a new Query for retrieving a single model specified by
the class and id.

unknown.tagValue: {Query}

params.name: klass
params.description: The class of the {Model} you're trying to retrieve.

params.name: id

name: findBy
description:
Creates a new Model Query for retrieving a single model matching the
predicates provided.

unknown.tagValue: {Query}

params.name: klass
params.description: The class of the {Model} you're trying to retrieve.

params.name: predicates
params.description: the set of predicates the returned model must match.

name: findAll
description:
Creates a new Model Query for retrieving all models matching the
predicates provided.

unknown.tagValue: {Query}

params.name: klass
params.description: The class you're trying to retrieve.

params.name: predicates
params.description:
An array of matcher objects. The set of
predicates the returned model must match.

name: count
description:
Creates a new Query that returns the number of models matching
the predicates provided.

unknown.tagValue: {Query}

params.name: klass
params.description: The Model class you're trying to retrieve.

params.name: predicates
params.description:
The set of predicates the returned model
must match.

name: modelify
description:
Modelify takes a mixed array of model IDs or model instances, and
queries for items that are missing. The returned array contains just model
instances, or null if the model could not be found.

This function is useful if your code may receive an item or it's ID.

Modelify is efficient and uses a single database query. It resolves Immediately
if no query is necessary. It does not change the order of items in the array.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - A promise that resolves with the models.

params.name: klass
params.description: The model class desired

params.name: arr
params.description: An {Array} with a mix of string model IDs and/or models.

return.description: A promise that resolves with the models.

name: run
description:
Executes a model {Query} on the local database. Typically, this method is
called transparently and you do not need to invoke it directly.

unknown.tagValue: {Promise} - A promise that resolves with the result of the database query.

params.name: modelQuery
params.description: The query to execute.

return.description: A promise that resolves with the result of the database query.

name: addMutationHook
description:
Mutation hooks allow you to observe changes to the database and
add functionality within the transaction, before and/or after the standard
REPLACE / INSERT queries are made.

- beforeDatabaseChange: Run queries, etc. and return a promise. The RxDatabase
will proceed with changes once your promise has finished. You cannot call
persistModel or unpersistModel from this hook. Instead, use low level calls
like RxDatabase._query.

- afterDatabaseChange: Run queries, etc. after the `REPLACE` / `INSERT` queries

Warning: this is very low level. If you just want to watch for changes, You
should subscribe to the RxDatabase's trigger events.

Example: N1 uses these hooks to watch for changes to unread counts, which are
maintained in a separate table to avoid frequent `COUNT(*)` queries.

name: removeMutationHook
description:
Removes a previously registered mutation hook. You must pass the exact
same object that was provided to {RxDatabase.addMutationHook}.

unknown.tagValue: currently registered mutation hooks

return.description: currently registered mutation hooks

name: inTransaction
description:
Opens a new database transaction and executes the provided `fn` within the
transaction. After the transaction function resolves, the transaction is
closed and changes are relayed to live queries and other subscribers.

RxDB makes the following guaruntees:

- Serial Execution: Once started, no other calls to `inTransaction` will
excute until the promise returned by `fn` has finished.

- Single Process Writing: No other process will be able to write to the
database while the provided function is running. RxDB uses SQLite's
`BEGIN IMMEDIATE TRANSACTION`, with the following semantics:
+ No other connection will be able to write any changes.
+ Other connections can read from the database, but they will not see
pending changes.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} - A promise that resolves when the transaction has
successfully completed.

params.name: fn
params.description:
A callback that will be executed inside a database
transaction

return.description:
A promise that resolves when the transaction has
successfully completed.

name: listen

params.name: callback
params.description: The function to execute when the database triggers.

params.name: bindContext
params.description: Optional binding for `callback`.

name: lib/database-transaction.js
DatabaseTransaction
description:
DatabaseTransaction exposes a convenient API for querying and modifying an RxDB
within a SQLite transaction.

You shouldn't need to instantiate this class directly. Instead, use
RxDatabase#inTransaction.

unknown.tagValue: RxDatabase#find

name: persistModel
description: Asynchronously writes `model` to the cache and triggers a change event.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} - A promise that:
- resolves after the database queries are complete and any listening
database callbacks have finished
- rejects if any databse query fails or one of the triggering
callbacks failed

params.name: model
params.description: A {Model} to write to the database.

return.description:
A promise that:
- resolves after the database queries are complete and any listening
database callbacks have finished
- rejects if any databse query fails or one of the triggering
callbacks failed

name: persistModels
description:
Asynchronously writes `models` to the cache and triggers a single change
event. Note: Models must be of the same class to be persisted in a batch operation.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} - A promise that:
- resolves after the database queries are complete and any listening
database callbacks have finished
- rejects if any databse query fails or one of the triggering
callbacks failed

params.name: models
params.description: An {Array} of {Model} objects to write to the database.

return.description:
A promise that:
- resolves after the database queries are complete and any listening
database callbacks have finished
- rejects if any databse query fails or one of the triggering
callbacks failed

name: unpersistModel
description: Asynchronously removes `model` from the cache and triggers a change event.

unknown.tagValue:
{Promise} - A promise that
- resolves after the database queries are complete and any listening
database callbacks have finished
- rejects if any databse query fails or one of the triggering
callbacks failed

params.name: model
params.description: A {Model} to write to the database.

return.description:
A promise that
- resolves after the database queries are complete and any listening
database callbacks have finished
- rejects if any databse query fails or one of the triggering
callbacks failed

name: lib/json-blob.js
lib/model.js
Model
description:
A base class for RxDB models that provides abstract support for JSON
serialization and deserialization, and attribute-based matching.

Your RxDB data classes should extend Model and extend it's attributes:

- {AttributeString} id: The resolved canonical ID of the model used in the
database and generally throughout the app.

name: lib/mutable-query-result-set.js
lib/mutable-query-subscription.js
lib/query-range.js
QueryRange
description:
QueryRange represents a LIMIT + OFFSET pair and provides high-level methods
for comparing, copying and  joining ranges. It also provides syntax sugar
around infinity (the absence of a defined LIMIT or OFFSET).

name: lib/query-result-set.js
QueryResultSet
description:
Instances of QueryResultSet hold a set of models retrieved from the database
for a given query and offset.

Complete vs Incomplete:

QueryResultSet keeps an array of item ids and a lookup table of models.
The lookup table may be incomplete if the QuerySubscription isn't finished
preparing results. You can use `isComplete` to determine whether the set
has every model.

Offset vs Index:

To avoid confusion, "index" (used within the implementation) refers to an item's
position in an array, and "offset" refers to it's position in the query
result set. For example, an item might be at index 20 in the _ids array, but
at offset 120 in the result.

unknown.tagValue:
{Boolean} - True if every model in the result set is available, false
if part of the set is still being loaded. (Usually following range changes.)

return.description:
True if every model in the result set is available, false
if part of the set is still being loaded. (Usually following range changes.)

unknown.tagValue: {QueryRange} - The represented range.

return.description: The represented range.

unknown.tagValue: {Query} - The represented query.

return.description: The represented query.

unknown.tagValue:
{QueryRange} - The number of items in the represented range. Note
that a range (`LIMIT 10 OFFSET 0`) may return fewer than the maximum number
of items if none match the query.

return.description:
The number of items in the represented range. Note
that a range (`LIMIT 10 OFFSET 0`) may return fewer than the maximum number
of items if none match the query.

unknown.tagValue: {Boolean} - True if the result set is empty, false otherwise.

return.description: True if the result set is empty, false otherwise.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} - the model IDs in the represented result.

return.description: the model IDs in the represented result.

unknown.tagValue: {Array} - the model ID available at the requested offset, or undefined.

params.name: offset

return.description: the model ID available at the requested offset, or undefined.

unknown.tagValue:
{Array} - An array of model objects. If the result is not yet complete,
this array may contain `undefined` values.

return.description:
An array of model objects. If the result is not yet complete,
this array may contain `undefined` values.

unknown.tagValue: {Model} - the model at the requested offset.

params.name: offset
params.description: The desired offset.

return.description: the model at the requested offset.

unknown.tagValue: {Model} - the model with the requested ID, or undefined.

params.name: id
params.description: The desired ID.

return.description: the model with the requested ID, or undefined.

name: lib/query-subscription-pool.js
QuerySubscriptionPool
description:
The QuerySubscriptionPool maintains a list of all of the query
subscriptions in the app. In the future, this class will monitor performance,
merge equivalent subscriptions, etc.

ModelQuery

An optional reference to a {RxDatabase}
the query will be executed on.

name: where
description:
Add one or more where clauses to the query
This method is chainable.

params.name: matchers
params.description:
Array of {Matcher} objects that add where clauses

name: include
description: Include specific joined data attributes in result objects.

params.name: attr
params.description:
Attribute that you want to be populated in
the returned models. Note: This results in a LEFT OUTER JOIN.
See {AttributeJoinedData} for more information.

This method is chainable.

name: includeAll
description:
Include all of the available joined data attributes in returned models.

This method is chainable.

name: order
description: Apply a sort order to the query.

params.name: orders
params.description:
An {Array} of one or more {SortOrder} objects that
determine the sort order of returned models.

This method is chainable.

name: one
description:
Set the `singular` flag - only one model will be returned from the
query, and a `LIMIT 1` clause will be used.

This method is chainable.

name: limit
description: Limit the number of query results.

params.name: limit
params.description:
The number of models that should be returned.

This method is chainable.

params.name: offset
params.description:
The start offset of the query.
This method is chainable.

name: page
description: A convenience method for setting both limit and offset given a desired page size.

name: count
description:
Set the `count` flag - instead of returning inflated models,
the query will return the result `COUNT`.

This method is chainable.

name: then
description: Short-hand syntax that calls run().then(fn) with the provided function.
